00001 #include "index_searching.hpp"
00002 #include "invertedindex.hpp"

00004 namespace aitools {
00005 namespace invertedindex {
00006 
00007 void search_index(const bfs::path& index_dir)
00008 {
00009         /* (1) Setup your configuration.
00010          */
00011         Configuration config;
00012         config.set_index_directory(index_dir.string());
00013 
00014         /* (2) Create an instance of IndexSearcher with the same entry type used
00015          * for building the index with the IndexBuilder.
00016          */
00017         IndexSearcher<IntFloat> searcher;
00018 
00019         try
00020         {
00021                 /* (3) Initialize the index passing the configuration.
00022                  */
00023                 searcher.init(config);
00024 
00025                 /* (4) Search the index for a given key.
00026                  * There are three overloads for the IndexSearcher::search() method.
00027                  * The version without any parameter returns the entire postlist if any,
00028                  * the other versions allow just to load a part of the postlist.
00029                  */
00030                 Postlist<IntFloat> postlist(searcher.search("2206"));
00031                 postlist.info(std::cout); // prints some info data
00032 
00033                 /* (5) Iterate the postlist.
00034                  * Use the Postlist::next() method to forward iterate the postlist.
00035                  * The function returns false if the end of the postlist is reached.
00036                  */
00037                 IntFloat value;
00038                 while (postlist.next(value))
00039                 {
00040                         std::cout << value << std::endl;
00041                 }
00042         }
00043         catch (const std::exception& error)
00044         {
00045                 Logging::error(std::string(error.what()));
00046         }
00047 }
00048 
00049 } // namespace invertedindex
00050 } // namespace aitools
